Kernel/sources/fs/initrd.c

00001 #include "initrd.h"
00002 #include <types/int_types.h>
00003 #include <initrd/initrd_header.h>
00004 #include <initrd/initrd_dirent.h>
00005 #include <initrd/initrd_fent.h>
00006 #include <stdlib.h>
00007 #include <debug/debug.h>
00008 #include <panic/panic.h>
00009 
00010 /* The intent of this file it to provide a interface to bind the initial ramdisk in its structure to the virtual file system of the operating system
00011    to do this it creates several lists of directories, files and several other arrays of memory to link the two.
00012    It also contains some functions the OS uses the query the initial ram disk such as ird_finddir, ird_readdir and read_ird
00013    The initial ramdisk is not writable
00014 */
00015 
00016 static uint32 mem_start = 0;
00017 
00018 static uint32* start_list = 0;
00019 static fs_node_t* file_list = 0;
00020 static uint32 num_files = 0;
00021 
00022 static uint32** dir_file_list = 0;
00023 static fs_node_t* dir_list = 0;
00024 static uint32 num_directories = 0;
00025 
00026 fs_node_t * initrd_root_node = 0;
00027 
00028 struct dirent* ird_root_readdir (fs_node_t* node, uint32 idx) 
00029 {
00030 
00031         if (num_directories > idx) 
00032         {
00033                 struct dirent * ret = malloc(sizeof(struct dirent));
00034                 strcpy(ret->name, dir_list[idx].name);
00035                 return ret;
00036         }
00037 
00038         return 0;
00039 }
00040 
00041 fs_node_t* ird_root_finddir (fs_node_t* node, char* name) 
00042 {
00043         int iter = 0;
00044 
00045         for (iter = 0; iter < num_directories; iter++) 
00046         {
00047                 if (strcmp(dir_list[iter].name, name) == 0) 
00048                 { 
00049                         return &dir_list[iter]; 
00050                 }
00051         }
00052 
00053         return 0;
00054 }
00055 
00056 struct dirent* ird_dir_readdir (fs_node_t* node, uint32 idx) 
00057 {
00058         
00059         if (idx > dir_file_list[node->inode][0] - 1) //Take away 1 to fix the double up bug. The value of the int loaded into that slot is the number of fentrys starting from 1, not 0
00060         { 
00061                 return 0; //No such file in the directory, way to far   
00062         }
00063 
00064         idx = idx + 1;
00065 
00066         struct dirent* ret = malloc(sizeof(struct dirent));
00067         strcpy(ret->name, file_list[dir_file_list[node->inode][idx]].name);
00068         return ret;
00069 }
00070 
00071 fs_node_t* ird_dir_finddir (fs_node_t* node, char* name) 
00072 {
00073         int iter = 0;
00074 
00075         for (iter = 0; iter < dir_file_list[node->inode][0]; iter++) 
00076         {
00077                 fs_node_t* file = &file_list[dir_file_list[node->inode][iter + 1]];
00078                 if (strcmp(file->name, name) == 0) 
00079                 { 
00080                         return file; 
00081                 }
00082         }
00083 
00084         return 0;
00085 }
00086 
00087 uint32 read_ird(fs_node_t *node, uint32 offset, uint32 size, uint8* buffer)
00088 {
00089         if (offset + size > node->length) return 0;
00090         uint8* loc = start_list[node->inode];
00091         memcpy(buffer, ((uint32)loc + (uint32)offset), size); //Copy the mem mems
00092         return size; //Not much error checking we can do. If a page fault occurs somethings gone wrong =)
00093 }
00094 
00095 uint32 write_ird(fs_node_t *node, uint32 offset, uint32 size, uint8 *buffer)
00096 {
00097         return 0; //Can't write to the RAM disk.
00098 }
00099 
00104 fs_node_t* initialize_initrd(uint32 start, char* name, fs_node_t* parent) 
00105 {
00106 
00107         mem_start = start;
00108         struct initial_ramdisk_header* header;
00109 
00110 
00111         struct initrd_dirent* en_ptr = 0;
00112         struct initrd_fent* fe_ptr = 0;
00113         uint32 iter = 0, i2;
00114 
00115         header = start; //Header = the start location
00116 
00117         if (header->ramdisk_magic != RAMMAGIC) {
00118                 printf("0x%x should be 0x%x\n", header->ramdisk_magic, RAMMAGIC);
00119                 PANIC("Error, RAMDISK magic incorrect");        
00120         }
00121 
00122         //Create the initrd node.
00123         initrd_root_node = malloc(sizeof(fs_node_t));
00124 
00125         uint32* dirchunk_start = start + sizeof(struct initial_ramdisk_header);
00126         num_directories = *dirchunk_start;
00127         dir_list = malloc(sizeof(fs_node_t) * num_directories);
00128         dir_file_list = malloc(sizeof(uint32) * num_directories);
00129 
00130         //En_ptr = Entry pointer, the pointer to the current directory entry
00131         en_ptr = ((uint32)dirchunk_start) + sizeof(uint32);
00132         
00133         //Add the directories to a list
00134         for (iter = 0; iter < num_directories; iter++) 
00135         {
00136                 strcpy(dir_list[iter].name, en_ptr->name);
00137                 dir_list[iter].inode = iter; //Useful when using the helper arrays
00138                 dir_list[iter].flags = FS_DIR; //Its a directory! Yay
00139                 dir_list[iter].readdir = ird_dir_readdir;
00140                 dir_list[iter].finddir = ird_dir_finddir;
00141                 dir_list[iter].length = en_ptr->fentrys;
00142                 dir_list[iter].parent = initrd_root_node;
00143                 dir_file_list[iter] = malloc(sizeof(uint32) * (en_ptr->fentrys + 1));
00144                 dir_file_list[iter][0] = en_ptr->fentrys; //So that the finddir and readdir functions know how many files are in the directory
00145 
00146                 uint32 * ptr = en_ptr;
00147                 ptr = ((uint32)ptr) + ((uint32) sizeof(struct initrd_dirent));
00148                 ptr += en_ptr->dentrys;
00149 
00150                 //Ptr = the first entry onto the list of files now.
00151                 int is = 0;
00152 
00153                 for (is = 0; is < en_ptr->fentrys; is++) 
00154                 {
00155                         dir_file_list[iter][is + 1] = *ptr;     
00156                         ptr++;
00157                 }
00158                 
00159 
00160                 if (iter >= *dirchunk_start - 1) 
00161                 {
00162                         en_ptr = ((uint32) ((uint32) en_ptr) + (sizeof(uint32) * en_ptr->dentrys) + (sizeof(uint32) * en_ptr->fentrys));
00163                 } 
00164                 else 
00165                 {
00166                         en_ptr = ((uint32) ((uint32) en_ptr) + (sizeof(uint32) * en_ptr->dentrys) + (sizeof(uint32) * en_ptr->fentrys) + sizeof(struct initrd_dirent));
00167                 }
00168         }
00169 
00170         //Find the file chunk header
00171         uint32* nm_files = ((uint32) ((uint32) en_ptr) + sizeof(struct initrd_dirent));
00172 
00173         num_files = *nm_files;
00174 
00175         start_list = malloc(sizeof(uint32) * (*nm_files));
00176         file_list = malloc(sizeof(fs_node_t) * (*nm_files));
00177 
00178         fe_ptr = ((uint32) nm_files) + sizeof(uint32);
00179         
00180         //Add all the files to a file list.
00181         for (iter = 0; iter < (*nm_files); iter++) 
00182         {
00183 
00184                 start_list[iter] = (start + fe_ptr->start) - 1;
00185 
00186                 memset(&file_list[iter], 0, sizeof(fs_node_t));
00187                 strcpy(file_list[iter].name, fe_ptr->name);
00188                 file_list[iter].inode = iter;
00189                 file_list[iter].length = fe_ptr->size;
00190                 file_list[iter].write = write_ird;
00191                 file_list[iter].read = read_ird;
00192 
00193                 fe_ptr++;
00194         }
00195 
00196 
00197         //Initialize the initrd node
00198         memset(initrd_root_node, 0, sizeof(fs_node_t));
00199         strcpy(initrd_root_node->name, name);
00200         initrd_root_node->flags = FS_DIR;
00201         initrd_root_node->readdir = ird_root_readdir;
00202         initrd_root_node->finddir = ird_root_finddir;
00203         initrd_root_node->length = num_directories;
00204 
00205         initrd_root_node->parent = parent;
00206 
00207         return initrd_root_node;
00208 }
